decks.notes: This Goblin deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing cheap creatures like Goblin Lackey and Goblin Piledriver to put pressure on the opponent early and often. The deck also includes powerful Goblin tribal cards like Muxus, Goblin Grandee and Goblin Ringleader to generate card advantage and maintain a steady stream of threats. The mana base is designed to support this aggressive game plan, with access to both disruption in the form of Wasteland and Rishadan Port, as well as utility lands like Karakas and Cavern of Souls to protect and support the Goblin creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly deploy evasive creatures like Ornithopter, Changeling Outcast, and Ingenious Infiltrator, while using Yuriko, the Tiger's Shadow to deal damage and draw cards off the top of the library. The deck utilizes disruptive spells like Force of Will and Fatal Push to protect its creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure and draw cards through its aggressive ninja creatures, while controlling the game with removal and counter spells.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly establish board presence and control the game by efficiently countering opponent's spells while also removing their threats. The deck utilizes a combination of powerful creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Delver of Secrets, alongside powerful equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte to put pressure on the opponent. It also includes a strong suite of counter spells like Force of Will and Daze to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain control throughout the game to secure a victory.

The main concept of this Canadian Threshold deck is to quickly apply pressure to the opponent with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dreadhorde Arcanist, while disrupting their game plan with countermagic and tempo plays like Stifle and Daze. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns to further control the board and provide additional threats. By efficiently managing resources and combining aggressive creatures with disruptive spells, this deck aims to win the game through a combination of early pressure and control elements.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on early disruption through cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will, while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dreadhorde Arcanist. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push, as well as disruptive cards like Daze and Plague Engineer. The mana base is built around fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent color access. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while quickly closing out the game with a mix of creatures and burn spells.

The deck focuses on using a combination of spells to set up a powerful win condition with Doomsday. It utilizes cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal to quickly generate mana, while also protecting its combo with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The key is to carefully sequence and plan out which cards to stack with Doomsday to ensure a successful win with Thassa's Oracle. The deck also includes cantrips like Brainstorm and Preordain to help find the necessary pieces for the combo.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements such as counterspells, removal, and card advantage to disrupt the opponent's game plan while efficiently deploying threats like True-Name Nemesis and Stoneforge Mystic to close out the game. The inclusion of cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Snapcaster Mage allows for versatile plays and flexibility in response to different situations. The deck also leverages powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Narset, Parter of Veils to further control the game and outvalue opponents. Overall, the key concept revolves around maintaining control and setting up a win condition through efficient and powerful cards.

The key idea of this deck is to generate mana quickly using cards like Dark Ritual, Lion's Eye Diamond, and Rite of Flame, while protecting the combo with Veil of Summer and Defense Grid. The main win condition is to assemble the pieces for a powerful storm combo using cards like Ad Nauseam and Burning Wish to search for key pieces. The deck also utilizes cards like Ponder and Brainstorm for card selection and manipulation. The goal is to ultimately storm off and overwhelm the opponent in a single turn for a decisive victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deploy threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan with efficient spells. By using cheap removal and counterspells, backed up by proactive threats like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Sprite Dragon, the deck aims to apply pressure while keeping the opponent on the back foot. With a mix of burn spells, card selection, and disruptive elements, the deck seeks to execute a streamlined game plan that punishes opponents for falling behind.

The main concept of this deck is to play aggressively while disrupting the opponent's game plan. It utilizes efficient threats like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf alongside disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to control the game. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns adds versatility and additional disruption to the deck. The deck aims to apply pressure early on, using cards like Daze and Fatal Push to keep the opponent on the back foot while maintaining card advantage with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by denying them resources with cards like Wasteland, Rishadan Port, and Thalia. It also aims to control the board with creatures like Mother of Runes and Flickerwisp, while also putting pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Palace Jailer. The deck also utilizes powerful equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice and Batterskull to further strengthen its board presence. Additionally, it has tools like Phyrexian Revoker and Recruiter of the Guard to answer specific threats from the opponent.

The main concept of this Dragon Stompy deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base and lock them out of the game with cards like Blood Moon, Trinisphere, and Chalice of the Void. By playing powerful threats like Goblin Rabblemaster, Bonecrusher Giant, and Karn, the Great Creator, the deck aims to quickly close out the game before the opponent can recover. The inclusion of cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Chandra, Torch of Defiance provide additional control and card advantage to help secure victory.

This deck aims to quickly generate mana with rituals and mana-producing artifacts, then cast multiple spells in a single turn to build up Storm count. By efficiently filtering through the deck with cantrips and hand disruption spells, the pilot can find a win condition such as Tendrils of Agony or Empty the Warrens to finish off the opponent. The deck is focused on creating explosive turns and overwhelming the opponent with a high Storm count. It requires careful sequencing and timing to maximize the effectiveness of each spell cast.

The deck aims to quickly assemble the Aluren combo by using various creatures with lower casting costs in combination with Aluren itself to generate an infinite loop. The deck also includes disruptive elements like counterspells and removal to protect the combo and control the board. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a companion to provide additional value and resilience. The deck utilizes powerful cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Teferi, Time Raveler to generate card advantage and tempo. Overall, the deck is designed to efficiently combo off while controlling the game state.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using Sliver creatures. The deck includes various Slivers that boost each other's abilities, making them stronger as a group. Additionally, the inclusion of disruptive elements like Unsettled Mariner and control cards like Force of Will helps to protect and support the aggressive game plan. The mana base is optimized for casting the Slivers quickly and efficiently, with a mix of lands that provide different colors of mana and utility. This deck aims to quickly establish a strong board presence and outpace the opponent before they can effectively respond.

The concept of the deck revolves around utilizing the graveyard as a resource to quickly fill it with cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Golgari Thug, allowing for explosive plays such as bringing out Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. Cards like Bridge from Below and Cabal Therapy are used to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating value from sacrificing creatures. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with an army of creatures from the graveyard and finish them off with powerful combos, making it a formidable force in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on assembling the Dark Depths combo as quickly as possible to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. It includes ways to search for Dark Depths and the necessary lands to sacrifice in order to put Dark Depths into play with zero ice counters. The deck also includes disruption in the form of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress to protect the combo and counteract opposing strategies. The goal is to win the game in a single explosive turn by creating a powerful Marit Lage token.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise, allowing you to cast powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Progenitus early in the game. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Leovold, Emissary of Trest and Teferi, Time Raveler to control the board and counter your opponent's spells. The goal is to overwhelm your opponent with efficient creatures and disruptive spells, while also having access to powerful tutor effects like Green Sun's Zenith and Natural Order to search for key cards.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly cheat powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack, combined with the free casting of these cards through Omniscience. The deck also includes various cantrips and counterspells to dig for combo pieces and protect them once they are on the battlefield. Cunning Wish offers additional flexibility in accessing sideboard cards to handle specific matchups. Ultimately, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with massive threats before they have a chance to respond effectively.

This deck revolves around using the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 indestructible Marit Lage token. The deck also includes ways to control the opponent's graveyard with Leyline of the Void and disruption with cards like Duress and Hymn to Tourach. The deck can also perform a secondary win condition with the combo of Grindstone and Helm of Obedience or generate a large storm count with cards like Lion's Eye Diamond and Infernal Tutor to win with Tendrils of Agony.
